definition: (proverb) a long illness makes the patient into a doctor
long illness makes the patient into a good doctor (idiom)

sentences.english: He was emaciated by long illness.
"What are the chances of my recovering?" asked the bed-ridden man.
sentences.chinese: “我病癒的可能性有多大？”久病不起的病人問道。

sentences.english: His health slumped after a long illness.
sentences.chinese: 久病之後，他的身體衰弱得很。

sentences.english: How is Mr. Richards getting along after his long illness?
sentences.chinese: 久病之後，不知查理先生現在過得如何？

sentences.english: His body was wasted by long illness.
sentences.chinese: 他的身體由久病而消瘦了。

sentences.english: She is regaining her vitality after a long illness.
sentences.chinese: 久病一場後她正在休養。

sentences.english: She is still weak after her long illness.
A long illness had emaciated the invalid.
"What are the chances of my recovering?"asked the bed-ridden man.
sentences.chinese: “我病癒的可能性有多大？”久病不起的病人問道。

sentences.english: He recovered slowly after his long illness.
My grandmother died hard, suffering through a long illness.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖母是久病後死的，死得很痛苦。

definition: (TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
old illness recurs (idiom); a relapse/fig. to repeat an old error/the same old problem
